summary:
Cinematic enb preset. Taste the sweetness of unique bloom and flares, while feeling the bitter cold of the harsh climate in Skyrim. Unleash the glory of a truely cinematic and playable enb. The bitterSWEET
performance friendy for the average system. New version offers better depth of field
descriptionHtml:
[b]

[/b][quote][color=#a4c2f4][size=4][b]If you like this enb head over to bitterSWEET advanced graphics mod[/b]
-same performance, better look-


[/size][/color][b][color=#a4c2f4][size=4]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58148/?[/size][/color]
[/b][/quote][b]





bitter[/b][i]SWEET [/i][size=3]enb[/size]
[size=3]A new cinematic and playable enb preset, focused on a semirealistic and cinematic look (which does not mean it is sepia or blueish or something like that)[/size] [size=3]EVERYWHERE. Performance friendly for the average system - and above...[/size]


Look up the screenshots for some impressions.
[size=3]
[youtube]MolxdUq275Y[/youtube]


This enb uses unique bloom and lens flare techniques, cinematic color-curves and tonemapping - so you will experience visual eye-candy just like in them fancy movies.


No COT needed. No Weather / lighting mods needed.[/size]
Why? - see below






btw screenshots use vanilla textures except the rocks. These use "rugged rocks"
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6225/?

[size=4][center]

Requirements:[/center][/size]

[size=3]binary files[/size]
[size=3]0.132 from enbdev.com[/size]
http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0132.htm

[size=3]I highly recommend the use of the mod " wearable lanterns" by Chesko[/size]
[size=3]and set its light to the value in the screenshots...[/size]
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17416/?






[size=5]


paq (probably asked questions)

[/size]
[size=3]Why no COT?[/size]
[size=3]CoT has hundreds of different weathers, all look beautiful itself, sure, but the thing is, with so many different types of weathers there will surely come up a very specific time... A Time of ugliest graphics and gitching lighting! [/size]
[size=3]But keep watching the skies, traveler, because with this enb, even the vanilla weathers look awesome.[/size]

[size=3]Why no sunrays?[/size]
[size=3]Come back when you found volumetric sunrays. Currently ENB does not support the volumetric calculation of light...[/size]

[size=3]NO, DoF? NO AO?[/size]
[size=3]These effect are deactivated by default, but they are ready to go. Just set the values to true in the ini...[/size]

Ambient occlusion is deactivated for now, since I have some massive bugs with distant ao popping in and gitching indoors and all that weird kind of stuff.
If you still want to have ambient occlusion - I only recommend them for some fancy screenshots

[center][/center]My system:

intel quad i5 3.4 Ghz
12 GB DDR3 RAM
Nvidia geforce gtx 745 
getting 30 fps on Skyrim Ultra settings and enb DoF and AO activated
author: LaBeatBeatbox
